text.div:
RelatedArtifact Logical Model

Items such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references, that provide background for the current item.

name: RelatedArtifact
title: shr-core-RelatedArtifact
description: Items such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references, that provide background for the current item.

element.definition: Items such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references, that provide background for the current item.

element.short: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.
element.definition: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.

element.short: A short label that can be used to reference the citation from elsewhere in the containing artifact, such as a footnote index.
element.definition: A short label that can be used to reference the citation from elsewhere in the containing artifact, such as a footnote index.

element.short: A string meant for reading by a person, for example, accompanying a code.
element.definition: A string meant for reading by a person, for example, accompanying a code.

element.short: A bibliographic citation for the related artifact. This text SHOULD be formatted according to an accepted citation format.
element.definition: A bibliographic citation for the related artifact. This text SHOULD be formatted according to an accepted citation format.

element.short: A unique URL on which the device may be contacted directly.
element.definition: A unique URL on which the device may be contacted directly.

element.short: A file that contains audio, video, image, or similar content.
element.definition: A file that contains audio, video, image, or similar content.

element.short: A URI that refers to a resource by its canonical URL (resources with a url property). The canonical type differs from a uri in that it has special meaning in this specification, and in that it may have a version appended, separated by a vertical bar (|).
element.definition: A URI that refers to a resource by its canonical URL (resources with a url property). The canonical type differs from a uri in that it has special meaning in this specification, and in that it may have a version appended, separated by a vertical bar (|).
